intro: Melandrium oldhamianum, commonly known as the Oldham's catchfly, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia, including China and Japan. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and woodland edges. It has hairy stems and leaves that are arranged oppositely along the stem. The fruit is a dry capsule that releases tiny seeds when mature.
